summary: Those mining for gold and other hardrock minerals on federal land must provide financial assurances, such as bonds, to ensure that lands they disturb will be restored. As of October 2017, the Bureau of Land Management held $3 billion in assurances and has a process in place to monitor these. As of November 2018, the Forest Service held $251 million in assurances. title: Hardrock Mining: BLM and Forest Service Hold Billions in Financial Assurances, but More Readily Available Information Could Assist with Monitoring
